definition: to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: Pour countries accepted the arrest warrant, told officers and soldiers themselves know the whereabouts of the person.
sentences.chinese: 倾国接下了通缉令，告诉官兵自己知道那人的下落。

sentences.english: Ben, fly her picture. Let's get a bolo broadcast out on her.
sentences.chinese: 本，把她的照片发出去，发布通缉令。

sentences.english: Will there be wanted posters of you on the walls?
sentences.chinese: 那儿的墙上会贴上你的通缉令吗？

sentences.english: The other really strange one is that there's a kind of a wanted poster for Lennon.
sentences.chinese: 另一个很奇怪的东西是，当时有一份列侬的通缉令。

definition: to order the arrest of sb as criminal/to list as wanted
an order to post a reward (for the capture of a criminal)

pinyin: Guo2 ji4 Xing2 jing3 Zu3 zhi1

definition: to pursue/to be after/to hunt down (the perpetrator of a crime, an escaped prisoner etc)
escaped criminal/fugitive from the law (criminal suspect on the run)
to pursue/to be after/to hunt down
to hunt and arrest (fugitives)/to track down and arrest/a manhunt
